Class BBjMultiListButtonWidget

extends BBjWidget

      Sets a text snippet to be used instead of simply listing the selected items in the edit area when closed example: "{1} of {2} items selected..."

    • Constructor Detail

      • BBjMultiListButtonWidget

        public BBjMultiListButtonWidget(BBjWindow wnd!, BBjInt id!, BBjInt x!, BBjInt y!, BBjInt w!, BBjInt h!)

        The constructor that creates the widget on wnd!

        Parameters:
        BBjWindow wnd!: parent window
        BBjInt id: the control ID
        BBjInt x: x-location
        BBjInt y: y-location
        BBjInt w: width
        BBjInt h: height

    • Method Detail

      • addItem

        public void addItem(BBjString text$)

        Uses the addItem function to add an item with the given text to the list

        Parameters:
        text$ the text with which the added item should be filled

      • addItem

        public void addItem(BBjString text$, BBjNumber f_checked)

        Uses the addItem function to add an item with the given text to the list

        Parameters:
        text$ the text with which the added item should be filled
        f_checked a number showing wether the box should be checked or not

      • addItem

        public void addItem(BBjString text$, BBjNumber f_checked, BBjString img$)

        Uses the addItem function to add an item with the given text and the image from the link to the list

        Parameters:
        text$ the text with which the added item should be filled
        f_checked a number showing wether the box should be checked or not
        img$ the link to the image file which should be added

      • addItem

        public void addItem(BBjString text$, BBjNumber f_checked, BBjImage img!)

        Adds an item with the given text and image to the list

        Parameters:
        text$ the text with which the added item should be filled
        f_checked a number showing wether the box should be checked or not
        img! the image which is supposed to be added to the cell

        public void redraw(Boolean f_init!)

        @Override This method is called whenever the widget needs to be rendered

        Parameters:
        Boolean f_init!: if TRUE the control is rendered for the first time so this method has to perform initial rendering

      • setEditable

        public void setEditable(BBjNumber ed!)

        Setting setEditable=false sets the control in a state that the drop down can be opened and reviewed, but the selection cannot be changed

        Parameters:
        BBjNumber editable! (0/1)
